availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Military organization (U.S.A.). Organized for one year of service in the United States Army. Companies A, B, E, and F mustered into service at Frankfort, Kentucky on February 19, 1864. Company F was mustered into service in Frankfort, Kentucky on March 29, 1864. Companies C, D, H, I, and K mustered into service at Camp Burnside, Kentucky on April 5, 1864. Mustered out on April 18, 1865. Commander(s): Colonel Francis N. Alexander.

ab.bibl: Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 286-300.
